result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J Sorensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will complete an AODA assessment and follow up recommended.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.

DE will not possess drug paraphernalia.

DE will maintain absolute sobriety.

DE will comply with all conditions recommended by DOC agent.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge. 

DE has credit of 4 days if revoked.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah J Sorensen

records.addlTxt:
03:48 PM Defendant Isaiah J Sorensen in court with attorney Ralph David Imholte.  Emily Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CM13, 21CM18, 21CM58, 21CM94.  Court recites agreement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea in 21CM18, 21CM58 Ct 2, Ct 1-DRI, 21CM94 Ct 1,  Ct 2-DRI and 22CM13 CT 1, Ct's 2, 3 DRI.  

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily made, court accepts plea of G, finds DE guilty.  Parties ask the court to adopt the recommended sentence. 

Recommended sentence will be for 24 months probation, DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended, DE will not possess drug paraphernalia, DE will maintain absolute sobriety, comply with all conditions recommended by DOC agent, pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.   DE will have 1 day credit in 21CM18, 8 days credit if 21CM58, 1 day cedit in 21CM94 and 4 days credit in 22CM13.

09:44 AM Defendant Isaiah J Sorensen in court with attorney Ralph David Imholte.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 21CM18, 21CM58, 21CM94-BBH and 22CM13 Init App.  22CM13-  Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  21CM18, 21CM58, 21CM94-Bond review.  Atty Imholte addresses the court as to the no contact with C.H.  Atty Imholte understands that CH has went to treatment and is now in the 12 step program, asking that the condition of no contact with CH be removed from the bond.  Atty Imholte offers the name/number of Elaine Smith who is providing the treatment for CH.  DE states he is currently at the TLP house as probation did not want him at his fathers home.  State believes both parties are in on going treatment, neither have completed treatment. 

 The court will lift the no contact provision with CH.  DE will remain absolutely sober,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. No discussion of any cases with CH. 22CM13 $1500.00 sign bond, same conditions as above.  Adj 10:07am.

Contact with CH will be non abusive. No discussion of any case with CH.    Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.
